meanings.definition: The total amount resulting from the addition of two or more numbers.
meanings.sent2: She calculated the sum of all the apples in the basket.
meanings.sent3: The sum of candies in the jar was so big, it looked like a mountain.
meanings.sent4: His kindness added up to a sum of joy in everyone's hearts.
meanings.sent5: The sum of stars in the sky was breathtaking.

meanings.sent1: He won a large sum in the lottery.
meanings.sent2: The sum required for the new car was too high.
meanings.sent3: The sum he spent on ice cream was enough to buy a small toy.
meanings.sent4: Her savings added up to a sum that made her smile.
meanings.sent5: The sum he donated to charity made a big difference.

meanings.definition: To calculate the total of two or more numbers.
meanings.sent1: She needs to sum the prices of all the items in the list.
meanings.sent2: I will sum the scores of the students to find the average.
meanings.sent3: He tried to sum the numbers in his head but got confused.
meanings.sent4: The teacher asked the students to sum the fractions for homework.
meanings.sent5: Can you sum the total distance we have traveled so far?

meanings.definition: To be the total amount of something.
meanings.sent1: The expenses sum to a large amount at the end of the month.
meanings.sent2: His hard work will sum to success in the long run.
meanings.sent3: The laughter in the room seemed to sum to a joyful atmosphere.
meanings.sent4: Her dedication will sum to a successful career.
meanings.sent5: The love and care they showed will sum to a happy family.
